intro: Terrellia canadensis var. glaucifolia, commonly known as the glaucous terrellia, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant is noted for its bluish-gray foliage, which gives it its common name, and its small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
